revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== From [[yan]], itself from the [[Old English]] '''{{m|ang|ƒÅn}}'''. ===Adverb=== {{en-adv|-}} # {{lb|en|dialect|Northern English dialect}} [[once]] (in both senses: [[only]] one [[time]], and [[formerly]]) ====Synonyms==== * See [[Thesaurus:once]] ===References=== * [2004], Griffiths, Bill, A Dictionary of North East Dialect, Northumbria University Press, {{ISBN|1-904794-16-5}}, page 191: * [1997], Leith, Dick, A Social History of English, Routledge, {{ISBN|0415097975}}, 9780415097970, page 45: ---- ==Scots== ===Adverb=== {{sco-adv|-}} # {{alt form|sco|ance|from=South Scots}} ===References=== * {{R:DSL|pos=adv., conj}}
